subject: Re: [junit] java versus junit tasks with ant
msgSnippet: There is no guarantee that an Ant expert trolls here.  Though you may get an answer here, I think you would be better served asking this question on the
messageBody:
There is no guarantee that an Ant expert trolls here. Though you may
get an answer here, I think you would be better served asking this
question on the ant-user list. See Jakarta's site for instructions on
subscribing to that list.

=jason

On Sun, 2004-04-11 at 20:01, nathan wrote:
> hello,
>
> i have a java-task in an ant builfile that runs(junit) successfully thanks to this yahoo group, but I am
> wondering if i am using the wrong task. here is the ant code:
>
> <target name="run-tests" description="Test with Junit" depends="compile-tests">
> <echo message="Running run-tests"/>
> <java
> classname="junit.textui.TestRunner"
> taskname="junit"
> fork="true">
> <arg value="${test.classpath}.TestMain"/>
> <classpath>
> <pathelement location="${dir.lib}/junit3.8.1.jar"/>
> <pathelement location="${dir.lib}/log4j-1.2.8.jar"/>
> <pathelement location="${dir.build}"/>
> <pathelement path=""/>
> <pathelement path="${java.class.path}"/>
> </classpath>
> </java>
> </target>
> my ultimate goal for the build process is to compile the source, test the compiled source code with
> junit, and throw build exceptions any time an error or failure is made during the testing. if all of the
> tests pass then the build would continue on to a publish task that would post the code to the net.
>
> thus my question about the java versus junit tasks. i am using java to run the junit tests, but dont know
> how to throw build exceptions. whereas with the junit-task (which i am not currently using) there are
> attributes, namely,haltOnError and haltOnFailure which quit the build process is any failures or errors
> occur.
> is there a way to achieve the same results using the ant java task, or should i just revert to using the
> junit task?
>
> thanks for any help with this.
